SEARCH
Package risk.server.domain

Klasse Risk

java.lang.Object
risk.server.domain.Risk
Alle implementierten Schnittstellen:
RiskInterface
public class Risk extends Object implements RiskInterface
The Risk class serves as the central hub for managing the game of Risk. It acts as an intermediary between the game's graphical user interface (GUI) and the underlying game logic encapsulated in the RiskAdministration class. This class is responsible for initializing the game environment, managing players, countries, and game states, and facilitating the various actions a player can take during the game, such as attacking, moving units, and claiming territories.

It utilizes the RiskAdministration class for most of the game logic, including player and country management, while also handling some game-specific tasks such as distributing starting units and validating attack conditions.

Key functionalities include:

  • Initializing the game with specified data for countries and continents.
  • Retrieving and displaying information about countries and players.
  • Managing players' actions such as adding or removing players, attacking, and moving units.
  • Handling the distribution of starting units and mission cards to players.
  • Saving and loading game states.
Siehe auch:
  • RiskAdministration
  • Player
  • Country

  • Konstruktordetails

    • Risk

      public Risk(String data)
      Constructs a new Risk game instance with specified data. This constructor initializes the game with the provided data string, which is used to construct file names for loading countries and continents. It creates a new RiskAdministration instance, passing the constructed file names for countries and continents data files.
      Parameter:
      data - The base string used to generate file names for loading game data. The actual file names are derived by appending "_Cou.txt" for countries and "_Con.txt" for continents.

    • getStringAvailableCountries

      public String getStringAvailableCountries()
      Retrieves a string representation of all available countries in the game. This method delegates the call to the getStringAvailableCountries method of the RiskAdministration class, which is responsible for compiling and returning the list of countries.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string listing all available countries, formatted according to the RiskAdministration's specification.

    • getAvailableCountries

      public List<Country> getAvailableCountries()
      Retrieves a list of all available countries within the game. This method calls the getAvailableCountries method of the RiskAdministration class, which is responsible for returning a list of all countries that have not yet been claimed by any player. The list contains Country objects, each representing a country available for players to claim.
      Gibt zurück:
      a list of Country objects representing all the available countries in the game.

If the country specified by countryName does not exist, a CountryNotFoundException is thrown.
      Parameter:
      countryName - The name of the country to be assigned to the player.

      A string message indicating the outcome of the operation.

    • pickRandomStartCountries

      public String pickRandomStartCountries() throws CountryNotFoundException
      Randomly assigns start countries to players at the beginning of the game. This method utilizes the RiskAdministration.pickRandomStartCountries() method to randomly distribute start countries among all players. The distribution ensures that each player receives an equal number of countries at the start, laying the foundation for the game's initial setup. If there are any issues in assigning countries, such as a country not existing in the game's data structures, a CountryNotFoundException is thrown.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the random country assignment process.
      Löst aus:
      CountryNotFoundException - If a country to be assigned does not exist.

If the player with the specified ID does not exist within the game's data structures, this method returns null.

      playerId - The unique ID of the player to retrieve.
      Gibt zurück:

    • removeCountryFromPlayer

      public void removeCountryFromPlayer(String countryName, String player) throws CountryNotFoundException
      Removes a country from a player's control within the game. This method delegates the removal process to the RiskAdministration class, which handles the detailed logic of removing the specified country from the player's list of controlled countries. If the country specified by countryName does not exist or is not currently controlled by the player, a CountryNotFoundException is thrown to indicate the error.
      Parameter:
      countryName - The name of the country to be removed from the player's control.
      player - The name of the player from whom the country will be removed.
      Löst aus:
      CountryNotFoundException - If the country with the specified name does not exist or is not controlled by the specified player.

    • addPlayerUnitsPerRound

      public String addPlayerUnitsPerRound(Player player)
      Adds units to a player at the beginning of their turn based on the current game rules. This method calculates the number of units a player is entitled to at the start of their turn, considering factors such as the number of countries controlled, continents controlled, and any additional units from trade-in cards. The calculation and addition of units are delegated to the RiskAdministration class.
      Angegeben von:
      addPlayerUnitsPerRound in Schnittstelle RiskInterface
      Parameter:
      player - The player object to whom the units will be added.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string message indicating the number of units added to the player for this turn.

    • addPlayerUnitsToCountry

      public String addPlayerUnitsToCountry(Player player, String countryName, int units) throws InvalidUnitException
      Adds a specified number of units to a country controlled by a player. This method delegates the operation to the RiskAdministration.addPlayerUnitsToCountry(Player, String, int) method, which is responsible for updating the game's data structures to reflect the new unit count for the specified country. If the operation is successful, a message indicating the number of units added and the current total is returned. If the specified number of units is invalid (e.g., negative), an InvalidUnitException is thrown.
      Parameter:
      player - The player object to whom the country belongs.
      countryName - The name of the country to which units will be added.
      units - The number of units to add to the country.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string message indicating the outcome of the operation.
      Löst aus:
      InvalidUnitException - If the specified number of units is invalid.

    • listAllCountries

      public String listAllCountries()
      Retrieves a string representation of all countries currently in the game. This method delegates the call to the RiskAdministration.listAllCountries() method, which is responsible for compiling and returning a comprehensive list of all countries, formatted as a string. The format and specific details of the string representation are determined by the implementation in RiskAdministration. This can include country names, IDs, or other relevant information based on the game's current state.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string listing all countries in the game, formatted according to RiskAdministration's specification.

    • getPlayer

      public Player getPlayer(int playerIndex)
      Retrieves a Player object based on the player's index in the game. This method delegates the retrieval process to the RiskAdministration class, which maintains the list of all players. It is used to access a player's information during the game, especially when player-specific actions need to be performed and the player's object is required but only the index is known.
      Parameter:
      playerIndex - The index of the player in the game's player list.
      Gibt zurück:
      The Player object corresponding to the given index. Returns null if the index is out of bounds.

    • getPlayerOnTurn

      public Player getPlayerOnTurn()
      Retrieves the Player object representing the player currently taking their turn. This method delegates the retrieval process to the RiskAdministration class, which maintains the current state of the game, including tracking which player's turn it is. It is used primarily to access the player's information during their turn for performing actions such as attacking, moving units, or playing cards.
      Angegeben von:
      getPlayerOnTurn in Schnittstelle RiskInterface
      Gibt zurück:
      The Player object corresponding to the player currently on their turn.

    • nextTurn

      public void nextTurn()
      Advances the game to the next turn. This method is responsible for transitioning the game state from the current player's turn to the next player's turn. It delegates the turn transition logic to the RiskAdministration.nextTurn() method within the RiskAdministration class, which handles the specifics of changing turns, including updating the current player state and any necessary game state checks or updates that need to occur at the end of a turn or the beginning of a new turn.
      Angegeben von:
      nextTurn in Schnittstelle RiskInterface

    • makeAttack

      public void makeAttack(String fromCou, String toCou, String attacker, int numberOfUnits, int defenderUnits) throws IllegalStateException, CountryNotFoundException, NotANeighbourCountry
      Executes an attack from one country to another by a specified player. This method delegates the attack logic to the RiskAdministration.makeAttack(Country, Country, Player, int, int) method, which is responsible for validating the attack conditions (such as whether the countries are neighbors and the player owns the attacking country), calculating the outcome based on the number of units involved, and updating the game state accordingly.

      If the attack violates any game rules (e.g., attacking from a country not owned by the player, attacking a non-neighboring country, or specifying an invalid number of units), appropriate exceptions are thrown to indicate the specific violation.

      Parameter:
      fromCou - The country from which the attack is initiated.
      toCou - The target country of the attack.
      attacker - The player performing the attack.
      numberOfUnits - The number of units used in the attack. This number must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to the number of units in the attacking country minus one.
      defenderUnits - The number of units in the defending country. This parameter is used to calculate the outcome of the attack.
      Löst aus:
      IllegalStateException - If the game state does not allow for an attack at this time.
      CountryNotFoundException - If either the attacking or defending country does not exist.
      NotANeighbourCountry - If the attacking and defending countries are not neighbors.

    • validateOwnership_

      public boolean validateOwnership_(String country, String attacker)
      Validates if a specified country is owned by a given player. This method checks if the player provided as an argument is the current owner of the country specified by its name. The ownership check is delegated to the RiskAdministration.validateOwnership(String, Player) method within the RiskAdministration class, which contains the logic to determine whether the specified player owns the given country.
      Parameter:
      country - The name of the country whose ownership is to be validated.
      attacker - The Player object representing the player whose ownership of the country is being validated.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the specified player owns the country, false otherwise.

    • validateAttackUnits

      public boolean validateAttackUnits(int numberOfUnits)
      Validates the number of units specified for an attack. This method checks if the number of units specified for an attack action is valid according to the game rules. The validation criteria include checking if the number of units is greater than 0 and does not exceed the maximum allowed units for an attack. The actual validation logic is delegated to the RiskAdministration.validateAttackUnits(int) method within the RiskAdministration class.
      Parameter:
      numberOfUnits - The number of units specified for the attack.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the number of units is valid for an attack, false otherwise.

    • validateRestOfUnitWhenAttack

      public boolean validateRestOfUnitWhenAttack(Country from, int numberOfUnits)
      Validates if the remaining units in the attacking country are sufficient after an attack is made. This method checks whether the number of units left in the attacking country, after deducting the units used in the attack, is within the permissible limits according to the game rules. Specifically, it ensures that at least one unit remains in the attacking country post-attack, as per the rules of Risk. The actual validation logic is delegated to the RiskAdministration.validateRestOfUnitWhenAttack(Country, int) method within the RiskAdministration class.
      Parameter:
      from - The country from which the attack is initiated.
      numberOfUnits - The number of units involved in the attack.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the remaining number of units in the attacking country is valid post-attack, false otherwise.

    • validateNeighboring

      public boolean validateNeighboring(Country attackerCountry, Country defenderCountry) throws NotANeighbourCountry
      Validates if two countries are neighboring. This method checks whether the specified attacking country and defending country are neighbors, which is a prerequisite for an attack in the game. The actual validation logic is performed by the RiskAdministration.validateNeighboring(Country, Country) method within the RiskAdministration class. If the countries are not neighbors, a NotANeighbourCountry exception is thrown to indicate the violation of this rule.
      Parameter:
      attackerCountry - The country initiating the attack.
      defenderCountry - The country being attacked.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the countries are neighbors, allowing for an attack; false otherwise.
      Löst aus:
      NotANeighbourCountry - If the countries are not neighbors, preventing an attack according to the game rules.

    • getCountryInformation

      public String getCountryInformation(String countryName) throws CountryNotFoundException
      Retrieves detailed information about a specific country by its name. This method delegates the task to the RiskAdministration.getCountryInformation(String) method within the RiskAdministration class, which is responsible for fetching and returning a formatted string containing the country's details. The information typically includes the country's name, owner, number of units present, and possibly other relevant details based on the current game state.

      If the country with the specified name does not exist within the game's data structures, a CountryNotFoundException is thrown to indicate the error. This ensures that the method caller can handle the scenario where a requested country is not found.

      Parameter:
      countryName - The name of the country for which information is being requested.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string containing detailed information about the specified country.
      Löst aus:
      CountryNotFoundException - If no country with the specified name exists within the game.

    • moveUnits

      public String moveUnits(String player, String fromCountry, String toCountry, int units)
      Moves a specified number of units from one country to another. This method is responsible for transferring units between countries, typically after a successful attack or for strategic redeployment. The actual movement logic, including validation of the move (e.g., ensuring the countries are connected and the player owns both countries, and that the number of units moved is permissible), is handled by the RiskAdministration.moveUnits(Player, Country, Country, int) method.

      If the move is not valid according to the game rules, an appropriate message detailing the reason will be returned. This could include reasons such as "Countries not connected", "Insufficient units in the source country", or "Player does not own one or both countries".

      Angegeben von:
      moveUnits in Schnittstelle RiskInterface
      Parameter:
      player - The Player object representing the player making the move.
      fromCountry - The Country object from which units are being moved.
      toCountry - The Country object to which units are being moved.
      units - The number of units to move.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string message indicating the success or failure of the move, along with any relevant details.

    • getAvailableColors

      public String getAvailableColors()
      Retrieves a string representing all available colors for players. This method calls the getAvailableColors method of the RiskAdministration class, which is responsible for returning a string containing all colors that players can choose for their units and territories. The format and specific details of the string representation are determined by the implementation in RiskAdministration. This can include color names or codes, depending on how colors are managed within the game.
      Angegeben von:
      getAvailableColors in Schnittstelle RiskInterface
      Gibt zurück:
      A string listing all available colors, formatted according to RiskAdministration's specification.

    • validateAttackConditions

      public void validateAttackConditions(Country from, Country to, Player player, int units, int defenderUnits) throws NotANeighbourCountry
      Validates the conditions for an attack between two countries in the game. This method checks if the attack initiated by a player from one country to another meets all the necessary conditions according to the game rules. These conditions include, but are not limited to, verifying that the attacking and defending countries are neighbors. The method delegates the validation process to the RiskAdministration.validateAttackConditions(Country, Country, Player, int, int) method within the RiskAdministration class, which performs the detailed validation logic.

      If the attacking and defending countries are not neighbors, a NotANeighbourCountry exception is thrown to indicate the violation of this rule.

      Parameter:
      from - The country from which the attack is initiated.
      to - The target country of the attack.
      player - The player performing the attack.
      units - The number of units used in the attack.
      defenderUnits - The number of units in the defending country. This parameter is used to calculate the outcome of the attack.
      Löst aus:
      NotANeighbourCountry - If the attacking and defending countries are not neighbors, preventing an attack according to the game rules.

    • continentPlayerCheck

      public String continentPlayerCheck(Player playerOnTurn)
      Checks if the player controls all countries in any continent. This method delegates the check to the RiskAdministration.continentPlayerCheck(Player) method within the RiskAdministration class. It is used to determine if the player on turn has full control over any continent, which can affect gameplay, such as granting additional units. The method returns a string message indicating the result, which could be the name of the continent controlled by the player or a message stating that no continent is fully controlled.
      Parameter:
      playerOnTurn - The Player object representing the player whose control over continents is being checked.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string indicating the name of the continent fully controlled by the player, or a message stating that no continent is fully controlled.

    • distributeStartingUnits

      public void distributeStartingUnits()
      Distributes starting units among all players at the beginning of the game. This static method calls the distributeStartingUnits method of the RiskAdministration class, which is responsible for the logic of distributing units. The distribution process involves calculating the number of units each player starts with and assigning these units to the players' countries. The exact distribution logic can depend on the number of players and the game rules regarding initial unit placement.

      This method should be called at the start of the game, after all players have been added and the countries have been assigned, but before any player takes their first turn.

      Angegeben von:
      distributeStartingUnits in Schnittstelle RiskInterface

    • printStartingUnits

      public static void printStartingUnits()
      Prints the starting units for all players at the beginning of the game. This static method delegates the call to the printStartingUnits method of the RiskAdministration class. It is intended for debugging or informational purposes, allowing a quick view of the initial unit distribution among players before the game starts. The actual printing logic, including the format and details of the output, is handled within the RiskAdministration class.

    • savePlayerInformation

      public boolean savePlayerInformation(List<Player> players, String filename) throws Exception
      Saves player information to a specified file. This method delegates the actual saving process to the savePlayerInformation method of the RiskAdministration class. It serializes the list of Player objects into a format suitable for storage (e.g., JSON, XML) and writes this data to the file specified by the filename parameter. The method ensures that all player data, including names, IDs, and current game states, are accurately saved, allowing for game progress to be persisted and later retrieved.

      This method can throw an Exception if there are issues with the file writing process, such as permission issues or disk space limitations.

      Parameter:
      players - A list of Player objects representing the players whose information is to be saved.
      filename - The name of the file where player information will be saved. This should include the path if the file is not in the default directory.
      Gibt zurück:
      true if the player information was successfully saved, false otherwise.
      Löst aus:
      Exception - If there are any issues encountered during the file writing process.

    • getPlayerInformation

      public List<Player> getPlayerInformation(String filename) throws Exception
      Retrieves player information from a specified file. This method is responsible for loading player information from a file, identified by the filename parameter. It utilizes the getPlayerInformation method of the RiskAdministration class to deserialize the list of Player objects from the file. The file format can be JSON, XML, or any other format supported by the implementation in RiskAdministration.

      This method can throw an Exception if there are issues with accessing the file, such as file not found, permission issues, or problems with the file's format leading to deserialization errors.

      Parameter:
      filename - The name of the file from which player information is to be loaded. This should include the path if the file is not in the default directory.
      Gibt zurück:
      A list of Player objects representing the players whose information was stored in the file.
      Löst aus:
      Exception - If there are any issues encountered during the file reading or deserialization process.

    • turnInUnitCards

      public String turnInUnitCards(Player player, UnitCard card1, UnitCard card2, UnitCard card3)
      Processes the turning in of unit cards by a player. This method is responsible for validating and processing the action of a player turning in three unit cards. It delegates the validation and processing to the validateUnitCards method of the RiskAdministration class. The validation includes checking if the cards exist, if they match according to the game rules (either all of the same type or all different types), or if any of the cards is a "Joker". Based on the validation, appropriate actions are taken, such as removing the used cards from the player's hand and returning them to the deck, and then granting the player additional units.

      This method does not return any value but indirectly affects the game state by potentially altering the number of units a player has and modifying the deck of unit cards.

      Parameter:
      player - The Player object representing the player who is turning in the unit cards.
      card1 - The first UnitCard object being turned in.
      card2 - The second UnitCard object being turned in.
      card3 - The third UnitCard object being turned in.

    • drawMissionToPlayer

      public void drawMissionToPlayer()
      Assigns a mission card to a player randomly. This method is responsible for the random distribution of mission cards to players at the beginning of the game or when a player successfully completes their mission and requires a new one. It utilizes the drawMissionToPlayer method of the RiskAdministration class, which contains the logic for selecting a mission card from the available pool and assigning it to a player.

      The method ensures that each player receives a mission that is not already assigned to another player, maintaining the uniqueness of missions among players. If all missions are assigned and a new mission is required, the method may implement logic to reshuffle the mission cards or handle the scenario based on the game rules.

    • drawUnitCard

      public void drawUnitCard(Player player)
      Assigns a unit card to a player randomly.
      Parameter:
      player -

    • loadOldGame

      public void loadOldGame(String filePath)
      Loads a previously saved game state from a file. This method is responsible for initiating the process of loading a game state from a specified file path. It delegates the actual loading logic to the loadOldGame method of the RiskAdministration class. The specified file should contain a serialized representation of the game state, including all player information, country ownerships, mission cards, and current game phase.

      The method does not return any value but updates the game state to reflect the loaded information. It is crucial that the file format and structure match the expected serialization used by the RiskAdministration class to ensure successful deserialization and game state restoration.

      Parameter:
      filePath - The path to the file from which the game state is to be loaded. This should include the full path and the file name.

    • getCountryInformationGUI_

      public String getCountryInformationGUI_(String country) throws CountryNotFoundException
      Retrieves detailed information about a specific country for the GUI. This method delegates the task to the getCountryInformationGUI method of the RiskAdministration class, which is responsible for fetching and returning a formatted string containing the country's details suitable for display in the GUI. The information typically includes the country's name, owner, and the number of units present.

      If the country with the specified name does not exist within the game's data structures, a CountryNotFoundException is thrown to indicate the error. This ensures that the method caller can handle the scenario where a requested country is not found.

      Parameter:
      country - The name of the country for which information is being requested.
      Gibt zurück:
      A string containing detailed information about the specified country, formatted for GUI display.
      Löst aus:
      CountryNotFoundException - If no country with the specified name exists within the game.
